name: Content.IsModuleLoadedByID
remarks: Checks if a module with the specified unique ID has been loaded (i.e., it's in the 'Modules' folder). Module IDs look like the following: "edcf99d2-6ced-40fa-87e9-86cda5e570ee", and can be found in Module Settings in the editor.

input.name: id
input.desc: the ID of the module, case insensitive

output.desc: true if the module is loaded, false otherwise

name: Content.IsModuleLoadedByName
remarks: Checks if a module with the specified name has been loaded. Module names can be found in Module Settings in the editor.

input.name: name
input.desc: the name of the module, case sensitive

output.desc: true if the module is loaded, false otherwise

name: Content.IsAssetLoadedByID
remarks: Checks if an asset with the specified unique ID has been loaded. Asset IDs look like the following: "66f65198-ff19-4fd9-a039-52cbe6f14c2b", and can be found as the "Asset GUID" in the editor.

input.name: id
input.desc: the ID of the asset, case insensitive

output.desc: true if the asset is loaded, false otherwise

name: Content.IsAssetLoadedByName
remarks: Checks if an asset with the specified name has been loaded. The names of assets are listed in the left side pane of the editor.

input.name: name
input.desc: the name of the asset, case sensitive

output.desc: true if the asset is loaded, false otherwise
